org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors
Class AeDefPathVisitor

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors.AeAbstractDefVisitor
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.visitors.AeDefPathVisitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeDefPathVisitor, IAeDefVisitor
Direct Known Subclasses:
AeDefNullPathVisitor, AeDefPathParallelVisitor
public class AeDefPathVisitor
extends AeAbstractDefVisitor
implements IAeDefPathVisitor

Visitor responsible for creating location paths for process definition objects. This visitor relies on the base class to do the basic visiting and traversing. The traverse(AeBaseDef) method is overridden here in order to determine what the location path should be for the given def. This location path is determined by using an instance of IAeDefPathSegmentVisitor. This level of indirection is necessary since the segment paths may differ by bpel version (i.e. switch/if).

Method Detail

traverse

protected void traverse(AeBaseDef aDef)
All of the base classes's visit methods call this traverse method. This gives us a single place to determine the segment for the current def and then create a unique location path for the def using this segment and its parent's location path. If this def doesn't have a segment, then we'll traverse it and continue visiting its children. If this def is a named def, then we'll create a path using its name in addition to its parent's path and its segment path and then traverse it. If this def is not a named def, then we'll create a path using only its parent's path and its segment path and then traverse it.

Overrides:
traverse in class AeAbstractDefVisitor
Parameters:
aDef -
See Also:
AeAbstractDefVisitor.traverse(org.activebpel.rt.bpel.def.AeBaseDef)

createPathAndTraverse

private void createPathAndTraverse(AeBaseDef aDef,
                                   java.lang.String aAppendPath,
                                   java.lang.String aNamePath)
Accepts the extra arg of a name path which will be non null for AeNamedDef instances that had a non-null value for their name. This allows for more user friendly xpath names while not running into problem of generating inaccurate xpath.

Parameters:
aDef - - the definition object we're visiting
aAppendPath - - the path to the def object
aNamePath - - the path with the name attribute in it
